snippet: Officers in an airport program intended to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling.
abstract: Officers working as part of the Transportation Security Administration’s program to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling; Logan International Airport officers in Boston assert that passengers who fit certain profiles, like Hispanics traveling to Miami or blacks wearing baseball caps backward, are much more likely to be stopped, searched and questioned for suspect behavior.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC LICHTBLAU

lead_paragraph: Officers in an airport program intended to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling.

headline.seo: Racial Profiling at Boston Airport, Officials Say
headline.main: Racial Profiling Rife at Airport, U.S. Officers Say
headline.print_headline: Racial Profiling Rife at Airport, U.S. Officers Say
